overview_of_class: Advanced Online Storytelling is a 5-week course that prepares journalism students for their residencies by simulating a newsroom environment. It is an intensive exploration of advanced multimedia reporting, which gives students in their junior year the chance to apply all of their multimedia reporting skills to one single class project.
name: Advanced Online Storytelling
title: DOHA JOUR 342-0-70 Advanced Online Storytelling
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Journalism majors Juniors and above who have taken or currently enrolled in Journalism 321-0 or 323-0 or IMC 331-0 or STRATCOM 305-0.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Advanced Online Storytelling is a 5-week course that prepares journalism students for their residencies by simulating a newsroom environment. It is an intensive exploration of advanced multimedia reporting, which gives students in their junior year the chance to apply all of their multimedia reporting skills to one single class project.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
• Prerequisites: JOURN 323-0 Broadcast Production and Presentation OR JOUR 321-0 Magazine and Feature Writing OR IMC 331-0 Public Relation Communication Strategies and Writing OR STRATCOM 305- Message Strategy and Persuasive Communications.

  • Open to juniors and above JOUR majors only; for students going on residency

subject: JOUR
